ResearchProjectDef.label: mechanoid hacking basics
ResearchProjectDef.description: Gives access to the hacking table and the mechanoid platform. The hacking table can be used to hack into the targeting system of mechanoids, making sure they attack your enemy instead of your colony when activated. Also allows you to build mechanoid platforms, which are needed as a repair and as a power station for mechanoids.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Portable chemfuel charging platform
ResearchProjectDef.description: Allows the creation of portable chemfuel charging platforms, which supply your mechanoids with power while they explore the world. Can also be installed/uninstalled for a temporary power solution for your mechanoids.

ResearchProjectDef.label: mechanoid workshop
ResearchProjectDef.description: Build a mechanoid workshop, which is used to construct all kinds of mechanoid related contraptions and upgrades, and also for scrapping advanced mechanoid parts.

ResearchProjectDef.label: mechanoid controller belt
ResearchProjectDef.description: Learn how to control mechanoids directly with colonists using a mechanoid controller belt which can be crafted at the mechanoid workshop. Finally your non-violent colonists can participate in battle without feeling guilty. After all, it's the mechanoids doing the killing, not them, right?

ResearchProjectDef.label: Repair module
ResearchProjectDef.description: The repair module can be installed in the reactor of mechanoids. It can be loaded with mechanoid parts, and is capable of very rapidly drawing a large amount of power from the mechanoid, and redirecting it the the mech's internal mechanites. This activates the mechanites, which can repair damage consuming the parts, while slowing down the mechanoid temporarily.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Repair arm
ResearchProjectDef.description: Can be used to replace the arm of a mechanoid that has a repair module installed. This arm is capable of transferring mechanites charged by the repair module to other mechanoids, resulting in the other mechanoids being repaired. The arm is however not very suitable for combat.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Self destruct module
ResearchProjectDef.description: A simple upgrade, consisting of two mortar shells and a wire that short circuits when activated. A plasteel casing prevents that the explosives go off unintentionally. Let your mechs go with a bang!

ResearchProjectDef.label: Turret module
ResearchProjectDef.description: A module that provides both structural support and and interface for gun turrets and mortars. More research is required for installing each type of turret.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Gun turret mounting
ResearchProjectDef.description: Learn how to mount gun turrets on the turret module. Any gun turret that can be uninstalled after building, can be installed on the turret module. This module can only be installed on large mechanoids.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Mortar mounting
ResearchProjectDef.description: Learn how to mount mortars on the turret module. Mortars still have to be operated manually by colonists and don't draw any power from the mechanoid. This upgrade has only a few benefits compared to using traditional mortars (quicker setup when raiding, less space needed). However, having a few mortars installed on mechanoids is a good way to impress your enemies.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Battery expansion module
ResearchProjectDef.description: A module that increases the total power a mechanoid can store, at the cost of a small movement penalty.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Vanometric power module
ResearchProjectDef.description: A module that contains a vanometric power cell to provide a mechanoid with an infinite power supply, at the cost of a small movement penalty.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Belt interface module
ResearchProjectDef.description: A module installable on any hacked mechanoid, which acts as an interface to technically advanced belts like shield belts and smokepop belts normally worn by humanoids.

ResearchProjectDef.label: AI implanting
ResearchProjectDef.description: Research the possibility to implant AI Persona Cores in hacked mechanoids, giving full control over them for combat purposes.
